title: Currently, Caitlyn is under performing in her desired goal as a marksman
body:
@ Any Red

Hello all, just to shed some light on where  stand, I've been maining Caitlyn since season 3. Picked her up at about level 17, and have loved her gameplay. The marksman rework did wonders for her, making her actually a lot more skillfull to play, especially when managing your traps and keeping the zones controlled. However, the rework did something that Riot didn't intend. Caitlyn's power was shifted from early to way late game. Riot acknowledged this and nerfed her late game _slightly_ and buffed her early, but it didn't do much. The real reason she is weak in the early is in part the masteries.

Headshot was her early game pressure passive. Because of its 150% damage, enemies would lose cs because she was holding it. People were afraid to farm. However, with these changes, it scales with crit chance. It eventually outscales its former self, once you grab 2 crit items but until then Caitlyn's headshot just doesn't hurt. Furthermore, in league of Thunderlords, Caitlyn had a harder time because she isn't about burst damage. Sure it works alright with her animation cancel combo of E Q headshot, but thats only relevant when enemies engage on you, because its a defensive play. Caitlyn has much better synergy with Warlords because she wants to go into the late game now.

Honestly, Caitlyn is a bit underwhelming right now. Her late game is amazing with 5 traps and headshot hurting, but at the cost of her early. While this isn't necessarily a bad thing, if you want Caitlyn to be a strong early siege champ, I would recommend toning down the crit scaling, and making headshot a base of 150% bonus damage. Thank you for reading ^^

Edit: I was wrong about Headshot, the wording was just changed.

replies.body:
I am not an ADC player, ADC is easily my worst role.

That being said, I play support very often and I have seen Caitlyn do very well in Diamond bracket. Her early game is still very oppressive and her late game is better than it used to be. She needs no buffs.... her biggest "problem" is that she can't abuse Thunderlord's Decree as effectively as others (COUGH Miss Fortune COUGH)

Early game oppressive...? Sure, I've still won lane a few times. But statistics show her winrate only hits about 50% come 40 minutes +

I mean, I don't mind this late game power, but Riot wants her to be the early game lane bully it seems, and she is defiantly under-performing there. Then again, I'm not the best player in the world. I'm only plat 5, but this post was mostly about the direction Riot wants to go with her. Again, my proposed changes were to lower the crit scaling on headshot and give it back some oomph early game.
Because if she was winning early game, her win rate wouldn't be so pitifully low.

Hey Napalm,

I'm a HUGE Caitlyn player also. She was the first champion I ever really took seriously and wanted to 'main'. I'm also one of the people that worked on the Champion Update team helping mold Caitlyn into what she is right now. 

With that being said, I do feel that Caitlyn changed a bit of her early game power to her late game power. I max Q first then go to E. I do love the traps but I find more reliable damage with the other two. I also get Warlord's in the mastery tree because I feel that I am banking for that late game fight more than just doing the early game trade. This changes who I want to support for me. 

Another thing I'm finding hard is that Caitlyn has a hard time securing kills in a team fight. She tends to hope that an auto kills them and doesn't really have the ability to take them. 

I was hoping you'd be able to tell me what masteries, runes and ability order you are going. I'd like to talk about this more, see how you feel more compared to certain match-ups. I think she should lose early to MF and Lucian. They have early game steroids and ultimates that can be used effectively mid trade compared to Caitlyn where you are charging something. 

Excited to hear back from you :)


Ranger XIV

Hey Riot Ranger!

Glad to hear from you, and I agree with you on a lot of these cases. Like you, I max Q, E, then W. The q is for laning, damage, and farming, and E is because the escape is so vital in the meta. Disregarding damage on E, I max it just to see the cooldown go lower. Because traps are maxed last, her seiging power and defensive capabilities diminish. 

Caitlyn's teamfight isn't really about kills, the only time I seem to get them is saving ace-in-the-hole to pick off low health targets fleeing. Her DPS and safety is her team fight, as well as choosing where your team wants to battle, via traps.


For masteries, I go the ferocity tree, taking Warlords as my keystone. 5 ferocity, feast, 5 Vampirism, 1 bounty hunter, and warlords. I then spec into the Cunning tree with 5 Butcher, Total Biscuit, 5 merciless, and Dangerous game. my runes are a bit odd, but I am finding success with them. I 9 marks of flat damage, 9 seals of armor, then 5 glyphs of attack speed, and 4 glyphs of magic resist. Lastly, 3 Quints of attack speed. The extra little oomph from the glyphs is very nice, and helps make up for slightly less attack speed on her. 

As for her laning, the issue is I agree, she shouldn't beat them in lane. I believe Caitlyn shouldn't really be able to duel any adc. The issue is its too easy for them to get in her range, and out damage her. I think this is in part because of how strong thunderlords is on them, but also how available sustain is. I feel the main issue is she needs a support like Janna who can prevent aggression. Prior to thunderlords, enemies had to be careful about just dashing into Caitlyn. Although, Caitlyn's defensive combo has been nicely buffed. E Q Headshot does hurt, but again, the other burst adcs just do it better, and scale much like her.

I feel the best direction to helping Caitlyn would be making her traps slightly better at only one point. The traps are her siege power, and late game seeing 5 sprout under your tower is terrifying, as well as when they cut off choke points. Currently, she only reaches this fantasy late game. Maybe drop the cool down a tad while only at 1 point?

Definitely will be looking more into all this. There are eyes on this and we will not just abandon ship on Caitlyn. Caitlyn should be leaning more towards traps and that zoning aspect. I am not promising anything but no one likes when a champion feels worse than before.

Thank you for sharing your ideas and analyzing what issues Caitlyn has right now. A lot has changed, definitely hasn't settled yet.

I hope this is true.  You aren't the first Ritoer to make that exact promise nearly word for word and it's been broken in the past.  So please excuse me if deja vu fom hearing it again makes me nervous:

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/2n8M8JVj-riot-fearless-what-was-sona-made-for?comment=0003000300000002
Didn't he just say that he isn't promising anything?

Hmm, I guess so.  I got caught up in the PTSD and didn't notice, but regardless promises are empty words anyways.  Actions speak louder and if this is being worked on, something will happen regardless of what anyone says or not.  Discussion is just a means to that end.

No, thank you! I'm glad eyes are favorite zoning marksman. Her new kit is really promising, and just needs something to make her better than before. I'm glad you dropped by to share your views on her. I'll continue playing/experimenting with her, figuring out how to best utilize her.

Also a Caitlyn fan here; she has been my go-to ADC since Season 2... getting me to Plat 5 before her rework. Do you think there's any chance of getting some of her early game power back? Or is she not supposed to be a lane bully anymore...? I feel like now _she_ gets easily bullied in matchups that she used to go even or do well in. I never get to lategame with her because my early game is so awful. 

I don't have any reason to pick her anymore, and that makes me sad.

I actually think she lost a decent amount of damage with the new traps, at least early on. People seem to avoid them, wait until they can snap them out of headshot range, or a tank steps on them and you tickle them. 

I had a strategy of hiding traps in sneaky places and slowly whittling down enemies that insisted on breaking them (using its magic damage). Even put some traps in choke points that would get me kills on fleeing enemies. That simply doesn't happen anymore. :\
Going off this, the smaller traps are sometimes frustrating. Sometimes, it looks like they cover a choke but enemies can still waltz right on through.

Ya, the traps are very different. The first thing I was concerned about when the new Caitlyn trap was out was if Caitlyn mains could adjust to it really being the trap that gets hit and that it doesn't cheat at all.

The hardest part about effectively utilizing the traps are always being in position to make the most of them. Countless times I set them up around an objective, but enemies spring them when I am just out of range to follow through. Whats more is it still doesn't dent tanks. 

Regardless, the traps are still useful in holding objectives. After clearing vision around baron, traps can cut off the entire entrance to baron from Blue side's blue buff, or that odd zone next to it. If you are on blue side, they cut off the entrance from tribush/wraiths. Although that utility is amazing, but it can only be utilized at max ranked traps.

Traps help a lot in certain match ups. Against Vayne, they are a life saver. I often place them in bushes, and if she makes the mistake of tumbling into one of them, her invisibility ult gets crippled. Similarly, they help keep Twitch in check because they remove his ability to use the bushes. But, they don't do much against tanky opponents. Its so frustrating having a tank step on your trap, then a headshot tickling them. More often than not, the regen the damage. At least, in the early they do.

I can't help but feel like stronger traps would make all the difference. I recently played a game with  support Morgana, and that is when traps truly start to shrine. If morg's snare is followed up by a trap, it results in huge damage. Especially with 90 cal net and peacemaker thrown into the mix. But, Caitlyn's laning feels more on her support now. If she has one that can dissuade aggression, its much easier to scale into late game.

After playing a bunch of new Caitlyn, from PBE and on live, it feels like most of her power stems from the traps. Since they are maxed out last, her power comes late game. Unfortunately, I find little wiggle-room in her maxing order. Its too important for waveclear and safety to max Q and E respectively. Following that point up, since a lot of power is in her traps, the enemy can simply avoid them, or send undesirable targets into them.

For a final notion on her, it seems everything in her kit works with each other, except her ult. Q does full damage to trapped and netted targets, w and e mark someone for a headshot, headshot has synergy with her autos, but my personal favorite tool she has, her ult, doesn't seem to fit in so snug like everything else. Ace-in-the-Hole has always been my favorite ult, and it was what drew me to her in the first place. Alas, with each new champion that comes out, there seems to be another way to negate it's 'snipe' feeling. Maybe it can deal headshot's bonus damage to targets ensnared by a trap? Just spitballing ideas here though. 

tl;dr: Her trap centric gameplay is fun, unique, and does its job once they are maxed, but until then she misses a lot of power from her kit. Her Q and E are important to her survival, as Piltover Peacemaker gives waveclear, ranged harass, and guaranteed damage, while .90 Caliber Net provides a good source of magic damage, and an escape for her. Traps provide situational damage, and zoning. Given the choice, traps get maxed last. Maybe a shift to make them slightly better early game is in order, even if its a mana cost reduction? Lastly her ult is fun, but hard to utilize, and doesn't work with her other abilities like they do with themselves.

I've never identified myself as a Caitlyn "main," but I am an ADC main and she's been one of my top-played champs for a very long time.  I feel like Cait is better than before, but she's also more difficult now and I've had difficulty figuring out her optimal playstyle.

The changes to Headshot have been great, free triggers off Cakes and Nets with bonus range have done a lot for keeping enemies at the range you want.  The nerfed early frequency to every 7th shot from 6th in addition to the removal of armor pen have been markedly noticeable both in-lane and mid game.  Whereas the new reliance on crit dmg and crit chance has made itemization confusing.  A lot of her damage I feel is reliant on spamming traps and hoping enemies step on them, so ER seems like it SHOULD be the best first item, but in truth enemies will never step on your traps unless they aren't paying attention.  Because the armor pen was removed, it feels like she NEEDS to rush IE to do any damage, but its AD is now inferior to BT and her Q and R do not scale with crit, meaning less AoE damage and more kills barely escaping with less than 20 HP.

---

The nerfs to Peacemaker are very noticeable, but the recent buff has made up for a good portion of the lost power.  Still it's not what it used to be, but the new interaction with Headshot has put more emphasis on her old E Q combo which while increases her difficulty, also separates the more experienced Cait players from the usual rabble.

---

Cupcakes have lost **A LOT!** of inherent strength in favor of POTENTIAL power.  The charge system has been great for placing down the zone you need when you need it, but between tripling the CD(wtf...) and reducing the duration by an **entire 62.5%**, sieging and anti-sieging has become very difficult.  She's able to zone a lot less frequently for a considerably shorter amount of time.  Additionally, the complete removal of their damage(I'm confused how having metal teeth puncture your leg does zero damage) has made it so that enemies never think twice about stepping on them literally the moment you need to take even a few steps back, like say while waiting for the next minion wave.  Also, maybe I'm imagining it because she can set up more, but it feels like their hitbox is smaller...

---

With the slower travel time, smaller hitbox and shorter travel distance, Nets feel very awkward to use, but they provide a lot more damage.  Which isn't their primary function: making escapes, kiting and wall jumps a lot more difficult, in exchange for better dueling potential on the less common occasions these occur.

---

Her nerfed AS and 10% reduced AS effectiveness are both very noticeable until she has AT LEAST a complete AS item AND either Zerkers or a partial AS item.

---

Obviously I'm not saying all of these need improving, you're already aware better than I that many of them are done as tradeoffs for more potential strength or future buffs, but those are my own personal observations as to the changes to her kit thus far.

Hit the nail right on the head. Her potential damage is what makes buffing her so hard, because she can be overbearing with everything on top. I think the best course of action would be an incentive to max traps over net, such as having net's cd lowered if she hits a headshot on an enemy champ, even if by a second.

Other than being a relatively save pick what else does she actually have goimg for her early game?

If you want a lane bully you may aswell pick mf lucian or draven

Thats actually all she has. She can safely farm from 650 range. Enemy supports like Braum, Naut, Leona, Ali have no issue stepping on the traps. Headshot barely dents them. If she steps within her range to auto poke, thats begging Lucian do dash passive q, MF to cast make it rain, double up, then beat down on you, or the likes. Currently, its best to just farm and only poke when its 100% safe. Caitlyn HAS to get to late game as fast as possible.
The Q change really hurt her in my opinion. Her harass is very low if they just stand behind minions. She doesn't seem like an early game bully anymore....and that was what she had going for her lol.

caitlyns current design makes it so that if shes is dealing lots of damage shes unfun to play against

if shes not dealing lots of damage shes worthless as a adc.

> [{quoted}](name=Gigahappytown,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oEngKvPP,comment-id=0010,timestamp=2016-01-09T01:36:03.170+0000)
>
> caitlyns current design makes it so that if shes is dealing lots of damage shes unfun to play against
> 
> if shes not dealing lots of damage shes worthless as a adc.

pretty much

I think she is far better off then she was. Get someone in a trap? Headshot. Hit someone with a net? Headshot. Hop in a bush and kill a minion? Headshot. It requires no aiming to land, just point and click. Has insane range. And you can literally litter the battlefield with traps and the enemy has to hit them at some point. Her ult has always had problems in which it can be blocked but that is who she is. Build a runnans that now has crit and with her range you are an unstoppable auto attacking maniac from a safe range. (Longest range to be specific)
{{item:3094}} the range is real

Yes, her late game is much more powerful. I main her, and her range is the longest base. Trist, Kog, Jinx, and Twitch all out range her, albeit 2 of them under certain circumstances. The headshot only starts to leave dents once she grabs crit items, otherwise its a lower damage love tap every few autos. She can only litter the map with traps late game, and net is saved for defense. All of these things are amazing buffs from what Caitlyn once was, but they all really only apply to her late game, and last patch riot stated they wanted her to be an early game champ.

Again, Caitlyn is much better than before, late game.

That's not saying much.

"Caitlyn is shit late game." -Diamond 4 friend

And really, when I look at her kit, it makes sense. Her headshots HURT. I will never contest that. They hit like a truck. Except you need to hit people with your net or trap them first or get 6 autos. E will be used for escape primarily and her W is extremely hard to use correctly. Thus, her main steroid spells are unreliable. But they all rely on getting a headshot. And even though she CAN use autos to proc them instead of spells,her base AS is absolutely shit. The ONLY champion with less AS is Graves. Less AS means less headshot procs.

Now compare this to traditional late game carries like {{champion:29}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:96}} {{champion:222}} 

Twitch has an AS steroid, an AD steroid, and huge amounts of aoe.
Vayne has an AD steroid, and AD modifying steroid, and % true damage.
Kogmaw has % max health damage and a huge AS steroid
Jinx has an AS steroid, another AS steroid, and a MS steroid.

Caitlyn has headshot. That's it She is safe in lane. She deals relatively consistent damage and she can escape sticky situations. When headshots proc, they hit like a truck, but they don't proc often enough or reliably enough.

Hell, MF, who was the quintessential early game bully that falls off late game is now a huge threat at every stage of the game like Lucian purely because of the interaction with her W and passive and ult. She is better than Caitlyn late game.

Point and case. Caitlyn only breaches the 50% win rate come late game, whats supposed to be her weakest phase, and what was prior. Her traps are used for zone control though. When her team is on the siege, those traps are hell. She litters them under turrets, and the enemy has to avoid them. But, its all she has. People often remember when she was the queen of bot lane, zoning the enemy so hard they couldn't move anywhere without getting poked down, but times have changed. She isn't oppressive anymore, just safe.5
They also did a mistake in removing the damage from the W....

I love playing her because I like her skill set and voiceover etc.

The problem with her is that if you pick her into the lanes she is meant to counter (weak early game/short range adc {{champion:67}} {{champion:236}} {{champion:21}} {{champion:18}} , they have an easy time engaging on you and you have no chance to retaliate unless you stand in a bush. 

Now with everyone else rushing {{item:3094}}  they also have a range advantage over caitlyn who doesn't rush this item. 
Riot needs to either rework the item to only ever grant like 30 extra range (instead of the ridiculous 150 which puts even {{champion:15}}  over caitlyn) or change some of caityln skills, for example they could make her e root someone briefly as well as slow them so she can escape with it if she has to. Or reset half the CD if it hits a Champ.
Pretty much this.

Really, the increase in her Q cast time in exchange for more damage is my quarrel with new Caitlyn. The damage is great, but lawdy why would I ever use it in a duel when I can crit for 1k+s on 1-3 normal hits in that time instead?

They could affix her ult with an aoe or even penetration component...or both? So it's a risk to just walk infront of her ult to save a low hp bud.

Sure she has a ton of damage on Q/R but when can you use it in fights? Only from a range and probably only when they're not behind creeps for most damage efficiency. Her ult is a finisher or an initiator (but why would you initiate with it imo) that 50% of the time doesn't even work cause conveniently the ADC flashed infront to protect the 1-13-3 Sona, and lifestealed the resulting damage all up...or, you know, someone walked infront of it.

And yes, her base AS is atrocious.

In lane her headshot has always been meh to me until I get an IE or just a BFS. It's a small burst sure, but most people at bot have a means to heal it up or defend against it well (armorwise).

And yes, she can't abuse Thunderlord's as easily/well as other adcs.

I love the idea of changing her ULT

For example, if someone steps in front of it who is not the initial target, they take 150/200/250 or just 200% dmg.
Honestly all I want for Cait is the AP scaling/base damage on her traps. I never even played AP Caitlyn, but after seeing the AP Caitlyn videos on YouTube I'd love to try it.
I played against her as Graves ... didn't go well.

For me the problem with Caitlyn is that she competes directly with Tristana.

She's a tower sieging long range auto based champion with strong self peel. She competes in directly the same niche, so one of them is just going to be better, right now it's Tristana.

What if her trap got a little wider as it flew further from her? It's really hard to hit on enemy ranged champions with a dash at times and that makes it a lot harder for her in lane. They close the gap and out trade her and her only recourse is a perfectly aimed E. But it's pretty easy to miss near max range.

I'm also a fan of improvements to her traps. But buffing her autos or Q at all could easily make her overpowered or just overbearing against her already good matchups without helping her bad ones. And as much as I love playing Caitlyn I've also been on the receiving end of her constant max range harass in lane and don't want to see that get out of hand. I also wouldn't mind some kind of interesting buff to her R as it allows for a lot of counterplay so it isn't likely to be oppressive.

I'm a huge fan of her new power curve. I prefer late game to early game dominance.

As for a zoner, I feel like she's doing that pretty well? I can seem to lay five traps down at one time around baron/dragon and I'm usually able to keep the enemy team out. I dunno.

I wonder if she does need a bit of work though. Hmmm
about the change, how about making her W cost no mana? that would slightly help her in lane while not being relevant in her lategame.
the crit chance thing makes it so headshot gets 50% reduced crit change or if, for example, she has 80% crit chance headshot will deal extra 40 damage ?
I'm not really feeling caitlyn these days either. Mostly goes hand in hand with feeling like not having any traps until super lategame. Also because every other adc feels like they do more damage.

How to fix her

Make headshot also grant her a bonus 125 range for that AA 

Now she can bully with it again due to having the massive AA range of 775, combined this with the range bonus item and she can get an AA from very far away, returning her ability to bully by range on the headshots

i feel like she is just weak in the meta because of how ridiculously popular champions like zed, rengar and fizz are whose one and only job is to murder you as hard as possible. When more immoble and tanky metas are in place then cait thrives with her range and kiting

Since her pre-rework state, Cait received 5.64 extra starting base AD and one less stack required to proc Headshot early on, with the passive itself still dealing a minimum of 50% AD bonus damage to champions (it never dealt 150% bonus damage to champions, only minions) and now being able to harass enemies from the other side of the lane. On top of that, Piltover Peacemaker deals more damage, and while there's a steeper initial falloff, it deals more damage than before when sniping through the enemy minion wave on average. If anything, I'd say her early game was significantly buffed while her late-game has become even worse, since even with the crit scaling on her passive she ends up with much less raw AD (the stat she scales the best with) than before due to the itemization changes, as well as less attack speed. If Cait needs a buff, I'd prefer to remove her 10% reduced attack speed scaling, but in any case I don't think her early game specifically needs improvement.

http://champion.gg/champion/Caitlyn/ADC

As for the passive, before the rework, Headshot did 150% damage to enemy champions, and 250% to minions. It also ignored 50% of the opponents bonus armor. 

Caitlyn on release's 'headshot'
V1.0.0.108: Added. (Original Stats)

Headshot.png Headshot (Innate)
Every 8 attacks (attacks while in brush count as 2), Caitlyn will fire a headshot, dealing either 150% damage to a champion or 250% damage to a minion.

Her q also became more narrow, and harder to hit. Her cross lane harass is highly situational, and her ability to zone isn't reminisicent of what it used to be. She is good, and her lategame is amazing with access to 5 traps, headshots, and the new Rapidfire Cannon that ups her range and burst.

That's 150% _total_ damage, with the 50% bonus damage not interacting with crit. I recommend you check Caitlyn's patch notes [on the wiki](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Caitlyn/Background), which confirm this. The bonus armor penetration was also only truly relevant late-game, and the stacks required got brought down to 7 / 6 / 5 (now 6 at all ranks) for a long time. Her Q and E may be narrower, and she doesn't deal damage with her traps directly, but she's now able to Headshot instead, which increases her overall damage. She may be capable of late-game burst, if she comboes her abilities and attacks right, but I still think she's weaker there than she used to be overall, and stronger early.

I-I don't understand what you're trying to say...at the start of the game when you have no crit chance, Caitlyn's headshot deals 50% bonus damage +0 because there are no crit modifiers. Before, headshot had the 150% bonus damage. I just played a few rounds as Caitlyn to confirm that...

I can promise you that Headshot never dealt 150% bonus damage against champions at any point in the game. The damage bonus was always 50%, and any patch notes you read will prove that, including the ones in the link I put in the above post, which indicates that Headshot dealt 150% damage to champions. I personally dislike that phrasing, though, since Headshot's bonus damage doesn't interact with crit, whereas the accompanying autoattack still does.
I guess you're right. How strange. Any ideas on how to help Caitlyn out then?

If you mean buffing her so that she feels better, perhaps it might be worth removing both the spread and damage falloff on her Q, which would give her far worse waveclear and trickier back line sniping, but better poke, especially earlier on.

You're likely also right that Cait is at a disadvantage in League of Thunderlords, since she's a bit too slow to activate it reliably early on. Perhaps Stormraider's Surge might be a better fit in time, as it would allow her to kite enemies even harder while sniping them.
